div1.p: Pierre DeLassus De Luzierre to Moses Austin.

Memorandum of an agreement made and entered into this 14th day of Sept. 1805 between Moses Austin of the one part of Piere de Luziere of the other part Witnesseth that the said Luziere for and in consideration of the sum of two hundred Dollars—to be paid to the said Luziere or his Heirs or Assigns on or before the first day of January 1806 and also the sum of two Hundred Dollars per year paid quarterly to the said Luziere his Heirs or Assigns commencing the first Day of January 1806 and to continue untill the full end term and expiration of a partnership now existing between said Austin Luziere and John Rice Jones concerning the Mine A Burton all which payments are to be made into the said Luziere by the said Austin without default to the said Luziere hath hereby released all his right title interest demand claim or profit in and to any part of the Land on which said Austin now lives and also to any part of the profits of a Lead Manufactory or other establishment now on said Land confirming and warranting the same unto sd Austin his Heirs and Assigns from him the said Luziere his Heirs and Assigns for ever In witness whereof the said parties have hereunto set their hands and seals the day and Date above mentioned
